alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 6:17PM CDT until April 30 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Mud Creek Near Jacksonville affecting Rusk, Cherokee, Nacogdoches and Smith Counties. For the Mud Creek...including Jacksonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mud Creek Near Jacksonville. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect pasture flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.2 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 12/15/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 630 PM CDT.
